image.altText: A young woman with long dark hair and brown eyes smiles for the camera as she stands in front of plants

props.synopsis: Officials and people local to the hostile expanse of Western Australia where German backpacker Carolina Wilga was missing for 11 days reflect on the search for the 26-year-old and her remarkable survival.

title.children: Carolina Wilga safe and well with a remarkable story to tell

image.altText: A tail of a plane that crashed is seen stuck on a building

props.synopsis: A preliminary report on the Air India crash that killed 260 people in Ahmedabad last month says the plane's engine fuel switches were flipped off three seconds after take-off.

title.children: Air India plane's fuel switches flipped off before deadly crash

image.altText: An aerial photo showing a Navy ship in the open ocean, with a military jet flying overhead.

props.synopsis: As Prime Minister Anthony Albanese heads north to China for a week-long visit, Australia's defence force says it is watching for Chinese spy vessels off the Queensland and NT coastlines.

title.children: ADF watching for Chinese spy ships as PM heads to Shanghai

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Xi Jinping composite

props.synopsis: Much of the reporting about both China and the region has now fallen victim to the same worldwide trend: The news is utterly dominated by the ever-changing spectacle of the Trump administration.

title.children: The world is rewiring to face the new US reality

image.altText: playground stock

props.synopsis: It's clear many families face feelings of distress, not just stress, as school holidays approach.

title.children: School holidays aren't what they used to be — parents and kids are suffering

props.synopsis: This view inside some of the most precious and rare museum specimens on Earth is helping scientists to better understand the story of life — and it's all done without a scalpel in sight.

title.children: The CT scans that wiped millions off the value of a museum's collection

image.altText: first sat pic

props.synopsis: Satellite images show Iran's attack on a US military base in Qatar in June hit a dome housing equipment used for secure communications.

title.children: Pentagon confirms Iran's attack on Qatar air base hit dome used for US communications

image.altText: Red rocks depicting rock art

props.synopsis: The UNESCO has approved World Heritage status for the 50,000-year-old rock art of Murujuga, in Western Australia in Paris.

title.children: UNESCO approves World Heritage bid for rock art amid emissions concerns

image.altText: Donald Trump, raising his fist, and his wife Melania walk in front of a helicopter.

props.synopsis: Visiting the area of Texas hit by deadly flooding last week, US President Donald Trump defends government officials who have faced scrutiny over whether they could have done more to warn residents ahead of the disaster.

title.children: Trump defends state and federal response to deadly Texas floods

image.altText: Two men in wetsuits stand together near water

props.synopsis: The Mexican prosecutor leading the case against the suspected murderers of Jake and Callum Robinson says there's still no evidence of cartel involvement.

title.children: Mexican prosecutor prepares case against accused killers of Aussie surfers

image.altText: Two young boys in beenies pose with platic toy guns.

props.synopsis: Record numbers of drones and missiles are increasingly being launched at Ukrainian cities, in what analysts say appears to be a new Russian tactic.

title.children: More than 700 drones and counting as Russia ramps up new war tactics

image.altText: Erin Patterson looks at the camera as she sits in the back of a prison van

props.synopsis: As the jury revealed its verdict, a tension built over weeks of legal arguments and disputed versions of what happened the day Erin Patterson hosted her in-laws for lunch was resolved.

title.children: With four simple words, Erin Patterson's jury gave a community its answer

image.altText: A shirtless man with tattooes.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's most wanted men amassed grand wealth while luring his mates into a police trap. The problem is he may never face justice down under.

title.children: One of Australia's most wanted had everything. Now he faces 262 years' jail

image.altText: JoJo Siwa wears a suit as she waves to someone.

props.synopsis: US singers Jojo Siwa and Cari Fletcher have caused a stir in the queer community. Here's why.

title.children: Why singers Fletcher and JoJo Siwa have caused a stir in the LGBTQIA+ community

image.altText: A woman stands for a photo in front of a koala exhibit at the zoo with children whose faces are blurred

props.synopsis: It remains unclear how many Australians and their families remain stuck in Iran, more than two weeks after a US-brokered ceasefire with Israel was implemented.

title.children: Australian grandmother who fled Iran overland says DFAT 'not helpful'

image.altText: A red, black and white bulk carrier half-submerged in dark blue ocean water

props.synopsis: The death toll from the attack that sank the Liberian-flagged Eternity C ship is the highest from any seaborne assault carried out by the Iranian-backed rebels in the crucial maritime trade route.

title.children: At least four dead and 11 missing after Houthi attack on Red Sea cargo ship

image.altText: Mitch Starc raises his arms

props.synopsis: For years, Mitchell Starc's suitability to Test cricket was a matter of debate. But now, on the cusp of becoming just the second fast bowler to earn 100 caps for Australia, his greatness in the format is undeniable.

title.children: On the eve of his 100th Test, Mitchell Starc has fought his way to immortality

image.altText: Two men look at the debris of a monastery, with rubble strewn on the ground next to the structure.

props.synopsis: An air strike on a Buddhist monastery in Myanmar's central Sagaing region has killed 23 people taking shelter in the compound, according to witnesses.

title.children: Air strike on Buddhist monastery in Myanmar kills more than 20 people

image.altText: A birds eye view of the ocean waves coming to the top of a break wall which has grass and a footpath on top.

props.synopsis: Lancelin Shire president Linda Balcombe says support is needed to rebuild the town's dunes ahead of likely king tides expected in August.

title.children: Fears king tides could engulf tiny coastal town within months

image.altText: A photo montage of Lorde, Jimmy Barnes holding an ARIA #1 trophy, and Sleep Token's Vessel.

props.synopsis: From Lorde to Jimmy Barnes and Lady Gaga, we rank every 2025 album that has topped the Australian album charts this year so far.

title.children: These 14 albums were Australian chart-toppers. But which is the best?

image.altText: GHF image Rafah

props.synopsis: The United Nations says most of those killed had been close to aid sites managed by the US and Israel-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation.

title.children: UN says almost 800 people killed near Gaza aid hubs in six weeks

image.altText: A woman in a grocery isle of fruit and vegetables

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Australian organic producers will need to be recertified to be able to continue exporting their products overseas after a major certifier goes into administration.

title.children: Aussie producers scrambling as major organic certifier collapses

image.altText: A young man smiling at the camera while surrounded by long grass.

props.synopsis: After a tragic loss, this rural town took the mental health of its shearing community into its own hands, and hopes to spread the message to every shed across the country.

title.children: When Mitch died at 22, his town started a shearing event to save others

image.altText: England players Jofra Archer and Shoaib Bashir hug during a Test.

props.synopsis: England quick Jofra Archer takes a wicket just three balls into his Test return, more than four years after his last five-day game for England.

title.children: Jofra Archer strikes three balls into long-awaited Test return

image.altText: a  man embraces and passionately kisses a vacuum cleaner while lying in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: A film about a woman who dies from dust pollution and returns to posses her husband's vacuum cleaner is just one of the recent examples of cinema building Thailand's reputation for distinctiveness and creativity.

title.children: 'Thai film is like Thai food': Why global audiences can't get enough

image.altText: A man with black hair and glasses wears a face mask while animated spike proteins surround him

props.synopsis: As influenza cases rise, so do the number of myths about how to treat it. We separate fact from fiction in this quiz. Let’s see how you go.

title.children: Think you know how to protect yourself from influenza? Take this quiz

image.altText: Jannik Sinner shakes hands with Novak Djokovic at the net at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: As Jannik Sinner prepares to meet Carlos Alcaraz in another grand slam final, the Italian world number one says they have a few years to go before their rivalry can be compared to that between Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic.

title.children: Sinner says Big Three comparisons too early ahead of Wimbledon final

image.altText: A tree with stars in a night-time sky above.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's expansive night-time skies could offer tourism opportunities for outback businesses contending with years of low visitor numbers.

title.children: Outback NT tourism operators see bright future in 'dark-sky' trend

image.altText: Gout Gout takes a selfie with fans at the Monaco Diamond League.

props.synopsis: Seventeen-year-old Gout Gout wins the under-23 200m race at the Diamond League event in Monaco, where Jess Hull and Peter Bol beat national records.

title.children: Fans erupt for Gout Gout's under-23 win at Diamond League in Monaco

image.altText: A black and white group portrait of the English football team

props.synopsis: This year's British and Irish Lions will play nine matches on Australian soil. Their first forebears though played 35 matches in Australia, 19 of which were under Australian Rules. And they even beat one of the leading sides of the day.

title.children: When the British and Irish Lions took on Carlton at the MCG

image.altText: A woman with a white head covering.

props.synopsis: Hakimeh Rahimi wanted to pursue a career in textiles and dreamt of being a fashion designer, but as a child became a refugee and was unable to attend high school. Now in Australia, she hopes to open a sewing shop.

title.children: Despite limited opportunities, these women have honed their craft

image.altText: Woman in beanie and coat sits on park bench

props.synopsis: Amelia Bird would love to become a home-owner in Tasmania, but she isn't hopeful. Like many others, she is looking at what is being promised at this month's state election for people who want a place of their own.

title.children: These Tasmanians want to see housing as the number one priority this election

image.altText: Large red gallery room with gold-bordered paintings hanging on the wall and several people looking up at them.

props.synopsis: Some often-reproduced French Impressionist paintings might feel very familiar, but to see them in person is to experience them in an entirely new way, curator Katie Hanson says.

title.children: These Renoirs, Manets and Monets are in Australia for the first time

image.altText: People gather at Lake Burley Griffin to dragon boat

props.synopsis: More than 300 of Australia's best paddlers have travelled to Germany to compete in next week's World Dragon Boat Racing Championships — and there are 32 Canberra-based competitors among them.

title.children: The Aussies taking the world stage in this niche sport

image.altText: Two election placard - one says vote yes and the vote no to the voice of division.

props.synopsis: A wave of decisions to exclude First Nations Australians at the local government level has left many Indigenous communities feeling marginalised.

title.children: Voice failure causing councils to continue 'terra nullius lies'
